results.title: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Examines a wide range of imaging techniques and their many and varied applications, such as anthropologists using computer technology to probe the remains of Egyptian mummies to discover previously unknown facts about the health and life-style of these people, or doctors using magnetic imaging to view the brain and other organs to provide treatment without resorting to invasive techniques like exploratory surgery.
results.title_for_label: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED

results.title: Unseen horizons
results.creator_credit: Bernard Till, Terry Ashwood and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: A complete primary, secondary and specialised vocational educational system for the blind is maintained in Great Britain by the Royal National Institute for the Blind. All types of schools provided are shown.

results.title: Unseen harvest
results.creator_credit: Jim Northcott, British Information Services and Africa Film Service
results.brief_description: The Salamawe training school for the blind in Uganda. Blind students are taught to become farmers, and instruction from sighted Africans is given in many branches of land cultivation and in the handling of farm equipment. Rope and basket making, athletics and music, are enjoyed by the students.

results.title: Unseen enemies
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Stuart Legg and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the ravages of such diseases as leprosy, malaria, elephantiasis, yaws, yellow fever in various countries and what is being done, mainly through the World Health Organisation to eradicate them.

results.title: Unseen Bean
results.brief_description: Features two episodes of the popular Mr Bean sketches: “Back to school Mr Bean” sees the bumbling Mr Bean wreaking havoc in an art class, a judo lesson and a science class. It is however Mr Bean’s much loved Mini-minor which comes off second best. No-one in their right minds would let Mr. Bean loose with a pair of scissors, but in “Hair by Mr. Bean of London” he does exactly that. His perfect day of cutting and slashing is topped off when Teddy wins a prize at the fete. However at the train station Mr Bean is once again a victim of circumstance.

results.title: Unreserved : stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve
results.brief_description:
Unreserved : Stories from Truganina Explosives Reserve is the culmination of a community arts project involving local residents and some of Melbourne’s up and coming designers. Based on oral histories collected from local residents who have a connection with this historic site, a series of animations have been produced recreating some of the unique stories of this site.
Truganina Explosives Reserve, one of Altona’s last intact historic sites, is located 26 kilometres west of the city, and nine kilometres from Williamstown on the shores of Port Phillip Bay. The reserve was established by the State Government in 1901 for the storage and handling of commercial explosives. After its closure in 1962, the reserve lay dormant for more than 25 years, protected from the outside world by the two and a half metre high galvanised fence.
In the 1990s, the reserve became the site of an intense community battle aimed at saving the site from redevelopment. The community embarked on a quest to save one of the western suburbs’ most significant historical and environmental locations, the site of an important early Australian industry.

results.title: UnREAL
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a hit dating competition show, “UnREAL” is led by Rachel, a young staffer whose sole job is to manipulate her relationships with and among the contestants to get the vital dramatic and outrageous footage the program’s dispassionate executive producer demands.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

results.description: Set against the backdrop of a hit dating competition show, “UnREAL” is led by Rachel, a young staffer whose sole job is to manipulate her relationships with and among the contestants to get the vital dramatic and outrageous footage the program’s dispassionate executive producer demands. What ensues is a humorous, yet vexing, look at what happens in the world of unscripted television, where being a contestant can be vicious and producing it is a whole other reality.
description_for_label: Set against the backdrop of a hit dating competition show, “UnREAL” is led by Rachel, a young staffer whose sole job is to manipulate her relationships with and among the contestants to get the vital dramatic and outrageous footage the program’s dispassionate executive producer demands. What ensues is a humorous, yet vexing, look at what happens in the world of unscripted television, where being a contestant can be vicious and producing it is a whole other reality.

results.title: Unpacking Filmscapes - The Coloured Sky: New Women II
results.creator_credit: Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Yang Fudong’s five-channel video installation, ‘The Coloured Sky: New Women II’ (2014), marks an aesthetic departure from his signature output on 35mm black and white film to vivid colour.

results.title: Unmarried mothers
results.creator_credit: Michael Grigsby, Elaine Grand and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: A report on illegitimacy in Britain. Eight unmarried mothers are interviewed before and after the birth of their babies. They talk about contraception, abortion, adoption and the problems they face in society and in supporting a baby. The work of the National Council of the Unmarried Mother and Child, Mothers and Baby Homes and the social worker is shown. Narrated by Douglas Keay.

results.title: UNmarked
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
In a cruel world where perfection is paramount, where do the less than perfect stand? Winner of the ACMI prize for best student animation 2004.
